headline: Chocolate Pudding Shots
description: These chocolate pudding shots made with pudding mix, milk, vodka, and Irish cream liqueur are a fun alternative to Jell-O shots at your next party.
name: Chocolate Pudding Shots
recipeIngredient: 1 (3.9 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix
1 (8 ounce) container frozen whipped topping, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Beat cold milk and pudding mix in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and beginning to thicken, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in Irish cream liqueur and vodka, then fold in whipped topping until smooth.
Spoon into 16 small cups. Serve immediately, or refrigerate or freeze until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody:
Kahlúa works too instead of Bailey's
Make sure you Fold in the last step!!!!
Love this recipe!!!! #ReadyWhipTopping
I planned on serving this to my extended family so I didn’t use the vodka. It was loved by all ages.
I made the recipe and topped with Oreo crumbs they spray whipped cream added if wanted. It's a great thing to bring to and adult pot luck as dessert!
A definite HIT!!! Everyone loved them and wanted the recipe!
Vanilla Pudding: Made these using vanilla instead of chocolate and they were a big hit. put them in the freezer to set. The flavour of the Baileys came through with a rich cheescake like consistency.
Great small treat for adults. Used small plastic (disposable) shot glasses and tiny plastic spoons. Everyone loved them!

I made these last night for adult Halloween treats. They came out great! The only change I made was that I used 1/4 of the Bailey's Irish cream and 1/4 cup of Kahlua . Otherwise I followed the instructions as written. They set up to a nice mousse consistency in about 3-4 hours in the freezer. I will definitely make these again!
I substituted vodka for rum, since rum is sugar based.
Made these for a St. Patty's Day party. Was a very big hit!!!!!

Reduced the Irish cream to 1/4 cup, added 1/4 cup of Kahlua plus 2 oz. of vodka. Sprinkled Heath toffee bits on top. Served in 2 oz. lidded condiment cups. Makes 27 cups.

Served at adult ice cream social and everybody loved them and wanted recipe - will make again! Keep very well in freezer.
really strong alcohol taste. I've had better
These are a little taste of heaven in a cup! Made as-is. Perfect!!
This was a hit! The only change I made was using whipped vodka.
Made it as is and a batch with kalhua instead of baileys. Yum. I highly recommend piping the pudding into the shot cups.

Really good treat for the adults! Oops, when I printed the recipe there was a different description. I'll know next time to put them in the proper container AND in the freezer. I did put my plastic shot glasses into a plastic dish with a cover and stored in the fridge. It was soupy when we got to it but everyone still loved the treat. Thanks holly!
